    • Method Detail

      • reload

        public java.lang.Object reload()
        Contrary to its name, this doesn't necessarily reload the app. It is invoked on every request, and will only trigger a reload of the app if something has changed. Since this communicates across classloaders, it must return only simple objects.
        Specified by:
        reload in interface play.core.BuildLink
        Returns:
        Either - Throwable - If something went wrong (e.g., a compile error). - ClassLoader - If the class loader has changed, and the application should be reloaded. - null - If nothing changed.
